item.title: Report E-2025020297
item.description:
Report E-2025020297

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-21
  • City: PEMBROKE PINES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 21, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink had defective packaging and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer interior. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum of product was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020004
item.description:
Report E-2025020004

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-26
  • City: Tampa
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/26/25, at 16:58 hours, personnel in the CSXT McCloskey Yard, in Tampa, Florida, discovered PVCX 13298, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid leaking from top of tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Nyrstar Corporation, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-0126-00018). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found product leaking from top of the tank car. Contractor personnel found that the liquid line primary closure cap to be less than tool tight; and that the closure cap gasket was deteriorated. Response personnel applied a 2” pipe cap to the NPT threaded unloading adapter portion of the liquid line closure assembly to stop the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Bradley Turner). The car was held at location pending further repair by a certified tank car repair shop or One Time Movement Approval.

The damaged drum of product was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025020266
item.description:
Report E-2025020266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0428 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NLK. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Tamco HR-1370 Urethane Reducer was released from a 2.5-gallon metal pail due to improper packaging by the shipper. The release impacted trailer #3152158 and has almost dried up. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Infotrac and spoke to Bud. Report #381451. The metal pail was containerized into (1) 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report X-2025020809
item.description:
Report X-2025020809

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 4-pack box of Pond Champs AlgaeX algaecide/herbicide 1-gallon was wet. 1 bottle had dent on side & small crack hole near lid resulted to leakage. Outer package didn't have hazmat markings but the 4-pack box inside display a limited quantity diamond sticker.

item.title: Report E-2025020102
item.description:
Report E-2025020102

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 7, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of pentanes was damaged and released approximately three (3) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety, LLC (AS) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbents and containerized all spent material in one (1) 5-gallon pail.
